channel.title: My Old Kentucky Blog
channel.description: a music blog that parties with unicorns

item.title: My Old Kentucky Blog Session : JJ Grey : Live at Sun King Brewery
item.dc:creator: Dodge
item.description: This past December, Jacksonville-based singer/songwriter JJ Grey stopped by the Sun King Brewery in Indianapolis to spend some time with our friends and MyOldKentuckyBlog.com. We recorded some new cuts from his new album, This River, which is being released today through Alligator Records. This River is JJ’s seventh album and his first studio album [...]
item.content:encoded:
This past December, Jacksonville-based singer/songwriter JJ Grey stopped by the Sun King Brewery in Indianapolis to spend some time with our friends and MyOldKentuckyBlog.com. We recorded some new cuts from his new album, This River, which is being released today through Alligator Records. This River is JJ’s seventh album and his first studio album since 2010’s Georgia Warhorse. This River, like JJ’s previous releases, was produced by Grey and Dan Prothero, and recorded at Retrophonics Studio in Saint Augustine, Florida.

JJ continues his tour throughout April and May, and recently made a stop in Bloomington, IN. Remaining tour dates below.

JJ Grey – 99 Shades of Crazy (Live at Sun King Brewery)

JJ Grey – This River (Live at Sun King Brewery)

JJ Grey – Tame A Wild One (Live at Sun King Brewery)

JJ Grey Tour Dates:
Apr-16 Tue – Pittsburgh, PA – Mr Smalls Theatre
Apr-17 Wed – Detroit, MI - St. Andrews Hall

item.content:encoded:

item.title: MOKB Premiere : Suburban Living : “Video Love”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Last year, Norfolk, VA’s Wesley Bunch, aka Suburban Living, released the excellent Cooper’s Dream EP drenched in its nostalgia and heavy reverb. Today, he is following-up that release with the Always Eyes 7″ via Dialog Records. On the 7″, we get more of that reverb and sound that will draw your mind to [...]
item.content:encoded:
Last year, Norfolk, VA’s Wesley Bunch, aka Suburban Living, released the excellent Cooper’s Dream EP drenched in its nostalgia and heavy reverb. Today, he is following-up that release with the Always Eyes 7″ via Dialog Records. On the 7″, we get more of that reverb and sound that will draw your mind to times past. Last month, we heard the a-side “Always Eyes”, now listen and download the just as engaging, shimmering b-side “Video Love” below.

Previous:

item.title: Song : Poliça : “Tiff” (ft. Justin Vernon)
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Minneapolis’ Poliça teamed up with Justin Vernon of Bon Iver for the first single, “Tiff”, from her new album later this year. The pair performed the track this past weekend at Coachella (see video below). This is a reunion of sorts as the two contributed to the group Gayngs a couple of years [...]
item.content:encoded: Minneapolis’ Poliça teamed up with Justin Vernon of Bon Iver for the first single, “Tiff”, from her new album later this year. The pair performed the track this past weekend at Coachella (see video below). This is a reunion of sorts as the two contributed to the group Gayngs a couple of years back. Listen below.

item.title: MOKB Premiere : Baobab : “Magdelene Street”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Baobab is the solo project of Durham, NC resident Phil Torres. During live shows, Torres is joined by Whitney Trettien and together they loop guitars, synths, mandolin, amongst other instruments. On April 30th, he will be releasing his sophomore LP, BAYOHBAHB. For the song “Magdelene Street,” you get the full scope of [...]
item.content:encoded:
Baobab is the solo project of Durham, NC resident Phil Torres. During live shows, Torres is joined by Whitney Trettien and together they loop guitars, synths, mandolin, amongst other instruments. On April 30th, he will be releasing his sophomore LP, BAYOHBAHB. For the song “Magdelene Street,” you get the full scope of the lush instrumentation taking 60s and 70s folk/singer-songwriter sounds and putting a modern twist on it. Torres already released a trippy video to compliment the song, now we have the track for download. Find it below and pre-order and stream the album here.

MP3: Baobab – Magdelene Street

item.title: Song : Daft Punk : “Get Lucky” (ft. Pharrell & Nile Rodgers)
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Well, that did not take long. After releasing a commercial that was played at Coachella and during Saturday Night Live, Daft Punkis released the full stream of new song “Get Lucky” featuring Pharrell Williams and Nile Rodgers. This is a shimmering disco jammer that could have fit nicely in Michael Jackson’s Off The [...]
item.content:encoded:
Well, that did not take long. After releasing a commercial that was played at Coachella and during Saturday Night Live, Daft Punkis released the full stream of new song “Get Lucky” featuring Pharrell Williams and Nile Rodgers. This is a shimmering disco jammer that could have fit nicely in Michael Jackson’s Off The Wall LP. Random Access Memories is out May 21st via Columbia Records. Listen below.

EDIT: It looks like this is just a loop that someone made from the commercial.

item.title: Song : Empire Of The Sun : “Alive”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Empire Of The Sun is finally back with their first new music since all the way back in 2008 with their album, Walking On A Dream. “Alive” will appear on their new album, Ice On A Dune, slated to drop in June via Astralwerks. The song is everything you can want in a song [...]
item.content:encoded: Empire Of The Sun is finally back with their first new music since all the way back in 2008 with their album, Walking On A Dream. “Alive” will appear on their new album, Ice On A Dune, slated to drop in June via Astralwerks. The song is everything you can want in a song from the band. Listen below.

item.title: Video : Elliphant : “Make It Juicy” (ft. Eboi)
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Panties, moist, and juicy are the most common words that people have a strong dislike for in any context, except for moist in describing cake. Elliphant’s latest video for “Make it Juicy” does not do anything to help the latter of those three. The black and white video shows lots of liquid spewing [...]
item.content:encoded: Panties, moist, and juicy are the most common words that people have a strong dislike for in any context, except for moist in describing cake. Elliphant’s latest video for “Make it Juicy” does not do anything to help the latter of those three. The black and white video shows lots of liquid spewing out of the mouth and may be NSFW. Proper manners go all out the window on this one. Her self-titled EP is out now via Bigger Splash Records. Watch below.

item.title: Song : Beach Day : “Boys”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Hollywood, FL surf rock band Beach Day announced the release of their full-length debut, Trip Trap Attack, via Kanine Records just in time for the summer on June 18th. You might recognize them from their song in a recently circulated Victoria’s Secret commercial. The lead single from the debut is the sun-kissed “Boys”. [...]
item.content:encoded:
Hollywood, FL surf rock band Beach Day announced the release of their full-length debut, Trip Trap Attack, via Kanine Records just in time for the summer on June 18th. You might recognize them from their song in a recently circulated Victoria’s Secret commercial. The lead single from the debut is the sun-kissed “Boys”. It only clocks in at two-minutes, but its girl group harmonies drenched in sunshine is an appealing listen. Check it out for yourself below.

Tracklist:
01. Walking on the Streets
02. Boys
03. Beach Day
04. Stay
05. Seventeen
06. Trip Trap Attack
07. Little Weird
08. Come Back To Me
09. Wasting All My Time
10. Am I The Only One
11. We’ve Gotta Go

item.title: Song : Dale Earnhardt Jr. Jr. : “Hidin”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Detroit’s finest, Dale Earnhardt Jr. Jr., are looking to follow-up their 2011 full-length, Corporate World, sometime later this year. In advance of that, they will be releasing the Patterns EP via Warner Bros. on April 16th digitially and the vinyl on Record Store Day. We already heard the upbeat and long-titled “If You [...]
item.content:encoded:
Detroit’s finest, Dale Earnhardt Jr. Jr., are looking to follow-up their 2011 full-length, Corporate World, sometime later this year. In advance of that, they will be releasing the Patterns EP via Warner Bros. on April 16th digitially and the vinyl on Record Store Day. We already heard the upbeat and long-titled “If You Didn’t See Me (Then You Weren’t On The Dancefloor)”, now we get the equally infectious “Hidin”. Listen below.

Previous:
